metadata.title: CVE-2016-1666 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Multiple unspecified vulnerabilities in Google Chrome before 50.0.2661.94allow attackers to cause a denial of service or possibly have other impactvia unknown vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1666` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 50.0.2661.102-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1237
chromium-browser-l10n - 50.0.2661.102-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1237
chromium-chromedriver - 50.0.2661.102-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1237
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 50.0.2661.102-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1237
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 50.0.2661.102-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1237
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.14.8-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.14.8-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.14.8-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
oxideqt-chromedriver - 1.14.8-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
oxideqt-codecs - 1.14.8-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.14.8-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '50.0.2661.102-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1237').
oxide-qt package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.14.8-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
